1.content:
Tanner

Monday, August 15, 2016

6:20 AM


Hannah and I were excited about our first day of eighth grade at Quantum Streams Academe. Our new school was named after the city we live in. We had four classes together: Creative writing 303 (AP), Per-calculus (AP) and Computer Animation 202 (AP), and Drama.

Yes, we are smart. And we don't care who knows. All you have to do is study. Plus, Hannah is a good study partner. If we play our cards right, we might even graduate a year or more sooner.

Hannah and I know this year is going to be the best year yet. There are so many possibles that are new school has to offer us. Yes, our newly built 21st century school still has a few small things left to polish. But it has all the latest stuff. I just don't want to bore you with all the details.

Deleted Scene: Boring details ▼


They just finished building the new school. It has all the latest cool technology. This new school was designed with technology in mind. The school board even added new classes focused on computers, technology, and coding

The school board saved money by building a K-12 school instead of three separate schools. All the classrooms were inside, but had section separated sections for elementary school, middle school, and high school.

The busses are all electric with a diesel generator as backup. They even have solar panels and wind turbines to charge the buses and power the school.

Each section had their own school office, principal's office, gym, cafeteria (not that we be eating their barely edible food), and other rooms that are not important. We are not allowed to cross over to the other sections without permission. Since Hannah and I have AP classes we can enter into the High School section.

Hannah and I got personal tours of the whole school last month. Each classroom has access to its own dedicated gigabit internet, has the latest AC WIFI network, digital whiteboards, 4k cameras that record our lessons, blackboard-like features for homework for both the student and parent. Itâs a 21 century school, with digital books that always update.

Yes, our parents can now log-on and see what homework we have, are future homework, and our grades, and all the teacherâs notes at any time. Our teachers can personally write notes to each parent about each assignment or any comments they want the parent or student to know.

It was an effort to help boost grades and class attendance. If a student does not show up for a class, has missing homework, or any other trigger, the parents get a text or email alert. Now the parents can be actively engaged in our learning. YAAAY!

What Hannah and I like best is if we missed a day, or had to stay home, we can still watch the lesson live, or watch it again later if we miss something. We even get a copy of the notes from the digital whiteboard sync to our OneNote notebook.

Many of the parents were not sure about the cameras, because of piracy concerns, but they will be used this year as a test. I like it, because it helps us to playback what the teacher taught. Plus it keeps a record of what the teacher said in class. So they have to behave also.




Both our parents: my mom and Hannahâs dad, was in the middle school office. They forgot to bring our birth certificates to complete our registration. One would think that they could use last yearâs records, but they had a new system.

Hannah and I were with the other 15 parents and their children that had other issues that kept them from going to their first period. No one was happy being stuck there. The parents had places to be, and their kids wanted to be anywhere but here.

Up front, my mom and Hannah's dad was complaining about having to wait. They were fighting with each other on who should go first. They seem to care more about getting to work, then getting us into school. Or it may have to do with the fact that our parents are in the same room for more than five minutes,

Iâve never seen two people that dislike each other that much. Even children as young as five know how to behave better than our parents do, and that is when they are at their worst.

It seems the only thing those two agree on was they did not want to be at school over a silly thing that could have waited for another time. However, the school made it clear, no birth certificate, no school.

It bugged my mom, who was a little impatient today, that she had to physically and personally hand them my birth certificate. Well, she could have given it to me, but she doesn't want me to see it. I'm guessing it has to do with my father.



"Are those your parents fighting with each other?" A high school girl asked Hannah and me.

"Yah, they have always hated each other," Hannah said.

"It's been that way ever since Hannah moved next door to me when I was five," I said.

It was the last house available on the block, and since that first day. our parents hated each other. I sometimes think that they might have known each other before that, but could never tell. They told us that they never knew each other, and wish they never have to talk to each other. They never did explain why they hated each other. Or why they wanted me and Hannah to be friends.

"I thought you two were brother and sister," she said.

"Well...that is the way we feel about each other," Hannah said.

"And we're best friends," I said.

"Best Friends! We even joke about being twins since we share the same birthday," Hannah said.

"Seven minutes apart!" I said.

I'm the oldest. But Hannah acts like she is. Hannah says that girls mature faster than boys, so she's actually older. It's only seven minutes...so I caved and let her win...like I always do.

"I don't have any sisters. And my dad is going to have the son he has always wanted. My parents got divorced a few months ago so he can marry his mistress. They fight a lot, but they don't hate each other. They even forgave each other. But your parents!...argue just for the fun of it," she said.

The high school girl started to cry but stop when she noticed the tears running down her face. Both Hannah and I try to comfort her. She did not seem embarrassed to cry in front of us. Maybe it was because we have a similar situation.

I gave her a clean handkerchief that I had. You never know when you need one. Maybe a girl might be in need of one. But I just use to blow my nose.

"They do that all the time," Hannah said.

"But only if they are breathing the same air," I said.

"Why do they hate each other?" the girl asked.

"It's a mystery. But Tanner and I think it's because they use to know each other."

"But they denied knowing each other before that day Hannah moved next door," I said.

"We never did get your name," Hannah said.

"I'm Katie."

We explain to Katie that our parents refuse to tell us about my father, and her mom. We even stress the fact that they never allowed us to see our birth certificates. Katie told us that her mom showed her birth certificate long ago. Katie thinks it's odd that our parents don't want us to see our birth certificates.
1.title: A New Friend  (Tanner)

11.content:
Tanner

6:40 AM


Most of the students went to class leaving only a few students and their parents. Every other parent knew how to behave themselves. The principal only had to come out of her office to discipline Hannah's father, and my mother.

She thought it was a student at first. But when she saw our parents she knew she was in for a long morning. She made sure that everyone knew that our parents were acting like stubborn children. Then she told them that they will be last in line. That did not make them happy, but they realize they were being childish.


Hannah and I were at the other end of the office with Katie. We wanted to be as far away as possible.

Katie asked what we thought about the new school. We told her about the tour that we went on last month. It turned out she was there also but was in the ninth grade group, that had their tour an hour earlier.

"Katie! Hannah and I are taking AP classes this year. And we get high school and college credit." I said.

I wanted to impress her for some reason. And I did not know what else to talk about. Hannah's usually better at conversations than I am.

"Me too. My mom likes that I'm earning college credits at the same time." Katie said.

All three of us share the same two classes: Creative writing 303 (AP) and Pre-calculus (AP). Though, we did have other AP classes as well. Katie liked that we shared classes.

Katie smiled at me. "Maybe you and I can study together?"

My face turned red—only a little red. Of course, Hannah had to make fun of me. Katie whispered something into Hannah's ear and they both started laughing. They both would not tell me what was so funny. Girls!


The only eighth-grade class we had was history. All the other were AP classes over in the High School section. But Hannah and I were still technically middle schoolers. I think Hannah and I are the only middle school students that have AP classes.

After we graduate early, the school has a special college program that allows us to take AP classes at the school. Some are online, but others are in a classroom. It's free and allows us to get some of our basic credits out of the way before transferring to a university or community college.

"You two can eat with me at lunch. I'll make sure everyone is very nice to you." Katie said.

Hannah and I were a little disappointed since we could not eat with our eighth-grade friends. But our class schedule just did not allow for us to eat at the same time.

The Other day in her room we were talking about how excited we were about taking these advanced courses. She started to cry. She was afraid that she would lose touch with her friends.

I told her that we still had after school, cheerleading, and there was also the weekends. I reminded her that her friends live close to us. I reminded her that I was her best friend and that I would be here for her whenever she needed.

I'm the only boy she allows to see her cry. Not that I see her cry that often. She thanked me and hugged me very tight for a long time. I wiped some of her tears and told her that everything will be fine.
11.title: Open Doors...  (Tanner)

111.content:
Hannah

6:55 AM


The bell ranged for first period. High school and middle students started school at the same time, except elementary starts at around 9:00 PM.

My father and Miss Abigail, Tanner's mother, started to argue. They were arguing about having to wait for the meeting with the principal. They did not like that Tanner needed an afterschool program for P.E. We didn't need the afterschool program—it was just the best solution. One that both me and Tanner preferred.


Katie brushed some of her black hair from her eyes. I like how the midnight blue highlights were only on the hair in the front. She let some of her hair hide her chess, the rest was in the back. I wished my hair as long as hers.

Katie looked over at our parents. She told her that even after what her dad did, that both she and her mom forgave him. They are even friends on "speaking terms"—her words.

"If your parents hate each other, why do they allow you to be friends," Katie asked

A few weeks ago, Miss Abigail took me and Tanner to get new clothes. We both enjoy shopping together. It's almost like a mother-daughter bonding activity. I never knew my mom, but if I could choose any mom, it would be her. I just wish she and my dad will get along. Grow Up already!

Tanner hates to shop for clothes. Or maybe he just hates spending hours picking out clothes. So I thought I make it fun and put on a modeling show for him. I also made him do a little modeling too. His mom took lots of pictures. I knew he had a lot of fun. But he'll never tell anyone he did.

I helped Tanner to pick clothes that had style. Katie told me he looked very cute in what he was wearing today—I told him so. I think she likes him but she doesn't feel ready for a relationship. Personally, I think they should be friends for awhile. No use breaking up in a few weeks and not being able to stay friends. What a waste!

Tanner surprised me by picking out an outfit for me. He may not know what he should wear, but I think he knows what he likes to see girls in. Though, I did have to change it a bit. But for the most part, he was spot on. I'm even wearing the outfit today, except I have a different top on. The other top goes better with tomorrow's outfit.

"I wish I knew. His mom likes me. We even went clothes shopping a few weeks ago. She helped me pick out bras, something my dad doesn't feel comfortable doing." I said.

"Her dad does not like any boy she might bring over. What father would. But he likes me. We both hate sports, but we do talk about cool technology. Like the super battery that he is currently working on. It has about 20 times the energy density as a regular battery, and can be charged to 80 twice as fast." Tanner said.

Tanner was trying to impress Katie, who surprisingly, was impressed with what he was talking about. She even understood what he was saying. Her eyes were fixed on him. And I noticed her smile more when Tanner and she were talking.

Katie could not understand why our parents would bond with the other's child but still hate each other. We told her that our parents encouraged us to be friends.

"Sometimes I think her dad is my real dad. But why keep it a secret?" Tanner asked.

"Well, maybe they are your parents," Katie said.

"And why would they keep that from us?" I repeated.

"It's a mystery," Katie said.

Tanner and I have always joked about being twins. The more Katie talked about it, the more me and Tanner thought it was possible. We need to get our hands on our birth certificates.
111.title: It's a mystery... (Hannah)

1111.content:
Hannah

7:17 AM


I looked over at Tanner and study this face. We do look alike. There was that one time when we were eight, I convinced him to dress like me. Convinced? Well, more like highly encourage. He did not have a choice. And I also dressed like him just for the fun of it.

We was even able to fool both of our parents for the day. My dad almost took him shopping for new girl clothes. His mom wanted me to go with her to get my haircut. They were not so happy when we told them that we switched places. They did think it was a little cute. But made us promise never to do it again—we didn't listen. Today, I do not think we be able to pull it off. You can tell that I'm a girl. And Tanner's voice can no longer pass as a girl.

I would like to see if we could switch places and fool our parents again. Though, Tanner has no desire to pretend to be a girl. So I'm going to have to trick him into doing it somehow. And it would be fun to have a sister. I'm just teasing. But I think it's still possible.

"Is they anything you can think that might suggest that you are twins," Katie said.

"Well, we do have these dreams about being twins. I had one last night." I said.

"Hey, I also had one last night. I was going to tell you about it later," Tanner said.

We both had dreams about being twins on the same night? Not possible. We never went into detail about our twin dreams. Now I wish I had. Maybe we always had them on the same night. Maybe we even shared the same dream. I need to get with him later and see how much our dreams match up.

"Tanner, in last night's dream, where did we go after school ended?" I said.

"Well, in my dream, you dragged me down to cheerleading. You needed me to try out with you. When it was time for our tryouts, we both were suddenly wearing cheerleading outfits."

"And they didn't noticed that you were wearing the female version," I said.

I really want to see him in a cheerleading outfit. I think he'll look cute.

"I don’t know what a male version looks like. Anyway, then we made the team, but I did not want to join the team."

"Then they told us they needed us to be on the team together because we were twins," I said.

"Then they promised me a male version if I will join, after laughing at me."

"You two did shared the same dream!" Katie said.

"Do you think it is possible we are twins?" I asked.

"Hannah and Tanner, what more proof do you need. Those are twin names."

"If I could choose anyone to be my sister or twin, I would pick you Hannah."

"Thanks Tanner, I would pick you too, even over a twin sister."

"Well, then it's settle, you two are twins. Not only do you two share dreams, but your parents encouraged you both to be friends."

Katie's right. What parents would spend so much time with a child that is not theirs. Especially a child who's parent you hate.

"I'm heard that twins have a unique bond," Katie said.

"I still don't believe they would keep this a secret from us. But everything else seems to fit."

"But we still need proof. Then we need answers," Tanner said.

"Maybe you should try to get a DNA kit. They sell them at Walgreens and Walmart, but you have to send them in to get tested. You can test each other, and it's under $100. And they even email you the results."

"Or we can get ahold of our birth certificates, and save $100," Tanner said.

Tanner is right. We don't need to waste $100, if we can see our birth certificates. The DNA test will be Plan B.
1111.title: Twin Dreams  (Hannah)

11111.content:
Tanner

7:31 AM


Hannah told Katie that the principal wanted us to have buddies since we had so many classes in the High School section. We did not want a buddy. It made us feel like we were little kids that needed a big brother or sister to look after us.

"I'll be both your buddies. I can see us being very good friends," Katie said.

"You really think so?" I asked.

She smiled at me. "Yes, Tanner, I think you and I are going to be very good friends."

Hannah and Katie looked at each other. For a moment they were quiet. Then they started to laugh again. Why am I being left out in the cold? I know it has to do with me.

"What is so funny?" I said.

"Nothing!" Both the girls said at the same time.

"Come on! Don't leave me out in the cold. If we are going to be friends, I need to be part of the inside jokes. Come on, it's not fair."

"Fine Tanner!" Hannah said, "Katie tell him."

"Okay! I said...that...that you were cute." Her face was a little red. "But don't tell anyone! And don't think that means...I like you. Because...I think we should...should just be friends."

I knew my face was very red. And of course, Hannah had to point it out. She forgot that Katie blushed also.Katie thinks I'm cute. What does that mean?

"Stop teasing him. They'll be a day when a cute boy will make you turn red. And you wouldn't want Tanner to laugh at you."

Hannah apologized. She said that Katie was not the only girl that thought I was cute. But she wouldn't tell me their names. Only that they don't go to this school.

"I like your blue dress. And your hair." I said.

Her light blue dress when just below her knees. She had to wear a matching darker blue short sleeve shirt because her dress had straps and was a little low cut.

Her long black hair had little bits of dark blue highlights. Her highlights gave her hair a little personality. It was just noticeable if you were looking. She allowed some of her hair to hang in front.

"Thanks, Tanner, you look great too."

"Hannah helped me to pick it out."

"He would be lost without me. I told him I'll help him look good for girls," Hannah said.

"It's working," she smiled.

"Don't worry Katie. Hannah explained it to me. Sometimes, girls think boys are cute, but only want to be friends. I like that we are friends now. Maybe...you can help me out with girls this year."

"Sure...I guess...I can help you. A nice boy like you, what girl would not want you?"

I wondered if I and Katie can go out and do something fun. Maybe as friends. We just met, but I think she would be a fun girl to hang out with.
11111.title: Tanner's Cute?  (Tanner)

111111.content:
Tanner

7::54 AM


After thinking about it for a few minutes I went up to Katie. She and Hannah were talking about girl things. I heard something about clothe shopping. Katie smiled at me.

"Is there something you want to ask me?" Katie said.

"Katie, now that we are friends and all. I was wondering if maybe...we can go out and do something fun...you know, as friends." I said.

Katie was silent for awhile. My heart was beating. And I don't know why. It was only a PG-date. Just friends hanging out.

"I...don't know. I have to think about it," she said.

Hannah gave me a hug from behind me. "I'm proud of you Tanner. You finally asked a girl out. And she is a ninth grader," Hannah said.

Was she teasing me or being nice? I was blushing again. But at this point, I did not care. But Hannah did not point it out this time. Maybe, she was being nice.

"It's not a real date—just a PG-date. I thought she and me can go out and do something fun."

"A PG-date?" Katie asked

"A PG-date is when a boy and girl go out just for fun as friends. You can dress up nice if you want. But there is no pressure or expectations and no kissing," Hannah said.

"I heard some girls talk about that. I liked that idea. Having fun without having to worry about being boyfriend and girlfriend," Katie said.

"So Katie, how about it?"

"Well, I guess I..."



Katie was about to tell me her answer when her mom came rushing into the room. She had a meeting with the principal about Katie. She was holding lots of papers. What is it was this school and paperwork? It is a 21 century school, you think you can submit your paperwork electronically.

"Making friends already. I knew you would," Her mom said.

Katie's mom changed her name back to her maiden name after the divorce. Katie's last name is James.

"They're eight graders, but they are taking AP classes. We share pre-calculus and writing," Katie said.

"You watch out for them," Miss Parker told her daughter in a light-hearted voice.

"I already told them I would," Katie said.

Hannah and I explained to Miss Parker about the buddy system. And we also suggested to her about changing the title from "Buddy" to "Companion". "Buddy" seems so childish. It was not like we needed one anyways. But if we have to have one, then we wanted Katie.

She hugged her daughter and told her she loved her. Then she walked into the principal's office.


"Ok Tanner. What did you have in mind?" Katie said.

I was jumping for joy inside. But decided to not let on how excited I was in case she thought this was more than two friends hanging out.

"I guess we can eat pizza."

"As long as we can get extra sauce."

"Extra sauce! That’s my favorite!"

"We can order the pizza and eat it at my house. I'm working on a coding project?"

"You code? I can tell we are going to be great friends."

Hannah doesn't like to code so she left us to talk. She went over to her father for a few minutes. Katie and I talked about our coding skills. She knows things I don't and I know things she doesn't. No need to bore you with those details.

I told her about the game I wanted to make. She's told me that she was learning to write apps, and wants to learn about game design. She offered to help me to design it. It is a big project. And if she wants to spend time with me helping me, I'm not going to object.
111111.title: PG-Date,,,  (Tanner)

1111111.content:
Hannah

8:10 AM


It seems that Tanner and Katie are engaged in computer talk. I find coding boring. But I do know a little about HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. I have a website and I like to customize it. I don't need to ask Tanner every time I need help changing something.

I think Katie likes Tanner. And I mean more than friends. Before he asked her out, Katie and I were talking. She told me that she thought that Tanner was a nice boy. But she was not ready to date.

She did not want to ruin a good friendship before it began. I suggested putting Tanner in the Friend Zone. Katie just wanted real friends. Not a boy that she will break-up within a few weeks or months. And she did not want to break Tanner's heart. She thinks he is a nice boy. He deserves better than that.

Katie and I noticed that Tanner was mumbling something to himself. I told Katie he was just rehearsing something. I joked that Tanner was going to ask her out. Tanner? No way. He is not that bold.

After Katie agreed to pizza with Tanner. They learned they both know how to code. So I let those two lovebirds alone.

I went over to talk to my father. I told him a little bit about Katie and how Tanner liked her. He even praised him for getting a date with a ninth grader. Just like a father would. I had to explain it was not a real date.

"My boy has a date with a ninth grader! I knew girls would like a nice boy like him." His mom said.

My father looked over at Heather. He suggested to her that maybe Katie needs Tanner and many boys in her life. It was not true. All Katie needed was someone to love her. Not for someone to suggest that she gives herself away.

I know my father. And he would never want anyone to call me that word. And I called him out on it. But quietly, because I didn't want Katie or Tanner to hear.

This was about Tanner's mom. He was suggesting that Heather was that...not Katie.

"Typical Sebastian. Just because Katie wants to spend time with my son, doesn't mean she's a..." she said.

"Well, Heather, you should know," my dad said.

Then they started to argue. And I left those two alone. No sense in talking to them when they are like that. If only I knew why.



"We have been here for over an hour," my dad said.

Tanner's mother got up and went to the front desk.

"You are wasting my time. I have more important places to be than being stuck here with him," Miss Abigail said.

The woman at the desk leaned forward, She said it in a very calm voice, "I need you two to calm down. The principal will be with you shortly. Then you two can leave."

You knew she wanted to tear into them. She told both of them to sit down and wait to be called on. Then she went back to her typing.

I'm not sure why they just did not let them complete their paperwork and throw them out. If they are going to act like children they are going to be treated like children.

I remember my father doing the same to me when I was little. I was six and I wanted him to take me to get some pizza. But I kept on bugging him. And he told me that I needed to wait till he was ready. And the longer I through a fit, the longer it took. Tanner told me a similar story with his mother.

My dad and Miss Abigail went back to their seats. They quietly started to argue over something. So I left them alone so that I did not have to hear them.
1111111.title: Hannah the Third Wheel  (Hannah]

11111111.content:
Reserved for future Chapter


I have about 2 other chapters I'm almost ready to post. But they still need to be edit.

(You can use the Google Chrome Grammarly extension to help you edit. As well as a free text to speech software to hear back what you wrote.)



8:26 AM

Katie told Tanner and I the story of her father Andrew. He just married his girlfriend Lily, and he is expecting the son that he always wanted. Katie was not sure that her father loved her. But both Tanner and I made sure she knew that she did. We told her that he was just not able to see what he had right in front of him.

Now, Lily is about ten years younger that Andrew. Katie believes that Lily was the one that convinced her father to move 45 minutes away to Scottsdale, Arizona where he was born. She believes that Lily hates her, and doesn't want her to come between her and their son. And I can totally see that.

Katie felt betrayed by her father when she found out what he did. At first she did not want to believe it, but after her mom told her, she cried for a long time.

Tears were running down Katie's face. She couldn't help it. I know the feeling. She tried to apologized for crying but we didn't let her. Then we hugged her.
11111111.title: [Placeholder] Katie needs friends...preview

info.brief_description: Tanner and Hannah find out their parents' big secret: They are Twins
info.description:
The Secret Twins


Rules Last Updated: 8/26/16

NOTE: I reserved the right to edit or delete chapters if you do not follow the rule.

Welcome to my first interactive story. I hope you enjoy reading the story but also enjoy writing a few chapters as well. Please read the rules (all the dropnotes, and popnotes) so I don't have to delete your chapter, or waste your time.

POV means POINT OF VIEW
The only point of views allowed are of Tanner and Hannah in 1st person. Keep in past tense.



Story background/plot setup.
You found out you have a twin of the opposite sex.

Tanner and Hannah have been friends since Hannah moved next door when she was 5. They are now 13 years young. One day they accidentally discovered their parentsâ secretâthey are twins. The story is the day-to-day events of Tanner and Hannah after they learned they really are twins.

Why did their parents keep this secret?
Why have they been living next door to each other this whole time?
How does this bring them closer together?


Most important Rule:
No one, especially the parents, can ever find out they know about each other, till after I, Agape Novels write that chapter, except for Katie. Then you can continue from that arc using the available information. However, close calls and the twins thinking their parents found out they learned about being twins are ok.

Basic rules:
Read every chapter in the Arc
The previous chapters leading up to the one your want to write. Please have fun writing, but also have fun reading. Take the time to write the chapter and put thought into it before posting.
before writing the chapter.
I reserved the right to edit, modified, or deleted your chapter.
Please do your best to check for spelling and grammar
I know, I have trouble with grammar and spelling also. Just take some time and effort and double check your work.
before you hit submit.
Keep it within the 13+ rating.
Not Sex, drugs, or LGBT, magic, body switching
Never end the story

Writing rules:
Keep story in First Person and correct POV.
Keep in pass tense.
Tanner and Hannah are retelling you the events of that day.
However events from the next day are future tense. Read More ▼

Tanner and Hannah are retelling the events of that day. So the events from the next day are unknown to Tanner and Hannah. Keep in mind that a day can spand many chapters.

The narration itself can not suggest anything that is immoral as being moral. Read more ▼

Even though you character might do these things, the narration can not suggest is ok to...
          Stealing
          Lieing
          Killing (No killing at all)
          Have sex outside of marriage (no sex at all)

Characters can have views or opinions that are immoral, but the narrative itself can not suggest that. The narrative must correct the views of the characters.

Don't modify Tanner and Hannah personality, or character.
Be consistent
Don't changes the history of what was written, or change names, or introduce plot holes.


Chapter rules:
Each chapter must be between 300 words to 750 words.
If you want to write more than 750 words just put "Continue" in the correct Slot. Example ▼

          Continue (Tanner's POV)
          Continue (Hannah's POV)

Please follow the below examples for chapter suggestions ▼
.
You got the end of the chapter and ready to put in your chapter choices.

          Suggestion (Tannerâs POV)
          Suggestion (Hannahâs POV)
          Suggestion
(Requires Basic+ Membership)
(Tanner or Hannah POV)

          Went to school.(Tannerâs POV)
          Next Day (Hannahâs POV)
          Went to the Mall (Hannah's POV)

Slot one is always Tanner's, slot 2 is always Hannah's, slot 3 is your choice. Just put who's POV in (POV).

Each plot option must be a choice that affects the story. Read more ▼

Add any suggestion you want, as long as your choice affects the story, and is not a pointless suggestion. I do not want to see chapters wasted on Selection List of options that make little or no impact on the story.

Examples of what not to do.
What dress did she choice?
What color dress?
High heels?
Did she go to bed at 11:00 PM
Did she go to bed at 10:00 PM

Just go with the flow. Try not to undo everything other authors introduced.
Each Chapter can not advance the story more than 3 days (without permission)

Things to consider
Do not suggest that Tanner or Hannah have any feelings for each other than brother/sister
It would be weird, and suggest something creepy. I like to avoid that.
.
When adding to the story, try to make it fun and interesting.
Just like in improv, go with the flow and don't try to undo the previous chapters.
Plot twists are welcome.
